examples.sentence: The scarlet 'A' in The Scarlet Letter stands for 'adultery'.
Getting straight A's doesn't guarantee career success.

She's dating a programmer who speaks Klingon.

The A register stores intermediate arithmetic results.

The sudden gust blew his toupee aback like a startled seagull.

The abacus in the museum had beads made of precious jade.

The abacus function in this software simulates traditional calculation methods.
Japanese soroban abacus competitions attract thousands of participants annually.

examples.sentence: NASA abbreviates 'National Aeronautics and Space Administration'.

I abbreviated my 2000-word essay to meet the limit.

We abbreviate 'application' to 'app' now.

This is an abbreviated spring festival gala for overseas audiences.
The teacher gave us an abbreviated explanation of quantum physics.
I only read the abbreviated news report during my subway ride.

The chemical element names are written in abbreviated form in the periodic table.

examples.sentence: The aberrant driver ignored all traffic lights.
His aberrant behavior made him walk backwards into the elevator.
The scientist studied aberrant chromosomes under microscope.
This aberrant tulip has black petals instead of red.
His sudden love for durian was seen as a dietary aberration by his vegan friends.
The politician's honesty was an aberration in that corrupt system.
The funhouse mirror created hilarious facial aberrations.
Lens aberration makes the photo edges look like melted cheese.
Astronomers calculate stellar aberration to adjust telescope angles.
The Hubble telescope corrects chromatic aberration with precision mirrors.
Wearing socks with sandals was considered a temporary mental aberration.
His obsession with collecting belly button lint was clearly an aberration.
High-end cameras minimize chromatic aberration like a pro makeup artist hides pores.
The hacker was accused of abetting credit card fraud.
Streaming pirated movies may abet copyright infringement.
Some tweets abetted the riots during the protest.
The cult leader abetted his followers to attack journalists.
Turning off surveillance cameras abets shoplifting.
His silence abetted the bullying in the classroom.
The accountant aided and abetted tax evasion.

examples.sentence: The construction project is in abeyance due to panda habitat protection.
Her gym membership remains in abeyance until she finishes her hotpot marathon.
The disputed island's sovereignty has been in abeyance for centuries.
The inheritance is held in abeyance until DNA test results arrive.
The tradition of morning tea ceremonies fell into abeyance during the bubble tea craze.
The court held the verdict in abeyance for more mooncake evidence.
She abhors the smell of durian as much as vampires hate garlic.
The environmentalist abhors plastic waste with burning passion.
He abhors traffic jams more than Monday mornings.
Ancient scholars abhorred the destruction of books.
The cat abhors water like a politician avoids direct answers.
He abhors social gatherings as if they were plague spots.
The judge abhorred the bribe offer with righteous anger.
Traditional chefs abhor using ready-made seasoning packets.
I abhor the thought of eating insects, even if they're protein-rich.

examples.sentence: She has an abhorrence of durian that rivals vampires' hatred of garlic.
His abhorrence for traffic jams makes him ride a unicycle to work.
The villagers' abhorrence of the monster inspired a yearly tomato-throwing festival.
Her abhorrence toward injustice fueled her legal career.
I feel abhorrence at seeing people lick yogurt lids in public.

examples.sentence: The abhorrent smell from the durian made passengers evacuate the subway car.
His abhorrent treatment of stray animals sparked outrage.
The scammer's abhorrent behavior ruined many families.
Leaving chewing gum under desks is absolutely abhorrent.
She gave him an abhorrent look when he suggested eating stinky tofu.
The abhorrent taste of bitter melon made the child cry.
His actions are abhorrent to the company's core values.
Wasting food is abhorrent to Chinese traditional virtues.
Plagiarism is abhorrent to academic integrity.
